I wonder if the use of the word "displays" has different connotations in UK English and American English. I see this word a lot in RHV docs, where I prefer the word "appears". "Displays" feels like an active verb to me: I display a painting on the wall, or the browser displays a web page. The painting appears on the wall, the and the web page appears in the browser.
I would say "appears" in this context:
"Preview your content as it appears on the..."

One of the first tech writing guidelines I learned was: Don't use "allows", Do use "enables".
"Enables" is more active and sounds more confident and purposeful than "allows".
I'd suggest: enables the following actions:
And if you go with this suggestion, then I think that the actions should start with gerunds (importing, uploading).
